items.sentence: I thought that we weren't supposed to talk about Tom.

Tom said that Mary is pretty good at speaking French.

I thought that Tom would go to Australia to see Mary.
I think we should let Tom go to Australia by himself.
I knew you wouldn't want to go to Australia with Tom.
I hope that Tom doesn't go to Australia next weekend.
I don't think Tom wants to go to Australia with Mary.
The painting hanging on that wall was painted by Tom.
Both Tom and Mary came to Boston when they were kids.
Tom says he and Mary didn't stay in Boston very long.
Tom said that he wished he could speak French better.
Tom poured the sugar from one container to the other.
Did something happen to me? I can't remember a thing.
If it snows on the mountain, it's cold in the valley.

I'm not going to get fired. At least, I hope I'm not.
I wish that things were the way that they used to be.
Romeo and Juliet is a tragic story of forbidden love.
Tom realized that Mary was deliberately avoiding him.
Mr. Jackson is the best French teacher I've ever had.
Tom didn't tell me that I wasn't supposed to do that.

All in all, nothing worthwhile comes without a fight.

You don't have the slightest idea what to do, do you?
Tom wasn't laughing at Mary. He was laughing at John.
This is the most exciting story that I've ever heard.
What's Tom doing here? I thought he was in Australia.
We've already done everything they've asked us to do.
One of our goals is to get children to exercise more.
